intro: Papaver pseudocanescens subsp. udocanicum, commonly known as the Udocanica poppy, is a rare and endemic species found in specific regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking pink to red flowers and papery, often hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
